Module jdojo.utility
Package com.jdojo.utility

Class Calc

java.lang.Object
com.jdojo.utility.Calc
public final class Calc extends Object
A utility class to perform basic calculations on numbers. All methods in this class are static. It provides methods to perform addition, subtraction, multiplication and division. jdojo
Since:
Version 1.0
Author:
Kishori Sharan

  • Method Details

    • add

      public static int add(int n1, int n2)
      Performs addition on two numbers. It returns the result of n1 + n2 as an int. If the result of n1 + n2 exceeds the range of the int data type, it will not return the correct result. For bigger numbers, use add(long, long).
      Parameters:
      n1 - The first number
      n2 - The second number
      Returns:
      Returns the value of n1 + n2

    • add

      public static long add(long n1, long n2)
      Performs addition on two numbers. It returns the result of n1 + n2 as a long.
      Parameters:
      n1 - The first number
      n2 - The second number
      Returns:
      Returns the value of n1 + n2

    • subtract

      public static int subtract(int n1, int n2)
      Returns the result of n1 - n2.
      Parameters:
      n1 - The first number
      n2 - The second number
      Returns:
      Returns the result of n1 - n2

    • multiply

      public static int multiply(int n1, int n2)
      Returns the result of multiplication of n1 and n2. It may return incorrect result if the value of the multiplication of n1 and n2 exceeds the range of the int data type.
      Parameters:
      n1 - The multiplicand
      n2 - The multiplier
      Returns:
      Returns the result of multiplication of n1 and n2

    • divide

      public static int divide(int n1, int n2) throws ArithmeticException
      Returns the result of integer division of n1 by n2.
      Parameters:
      n1 - The dividend
      n2 - The divisor
      Returns:
      Returns the result of n1 / n2
      Throws:
      ArithmeticException - If n2 is zero.
